text: CHUN-MING CHEN, the witness herein, having first been duly sworn on oath, was examined and testified as follows:
Mr. Chen, this is Andrew Rahaim. I'm the attorney for the plaintiffs. Can you hear me okay?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Can you start by giving the court reporter your full name?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: My name is Chun-Ming Chen.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And can you spell that for us?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Sure.  It's C, as in Charlie, H, as in Harry, U, as in umbrella, N, as in Nancy, hyphen, M, as in Michael, I, as in India, N, as in Nancy, G, as in George. Last name, C, as in Charlie, H, as in Harry, E, as in Edward, N, as in Nancy.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  And where do you live? What's your residence address right now?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I'm currently living in Texas.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  We couldn't hear you.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Is somebody outside on a cell phone?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I'm currently living in Texas.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  We're getting a tremendous amount of distortion here.  It's almost like somebody is talking on a cell phone outdoors.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Can you hear me now?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.  We'll see how it goes.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: So give us your current address.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: 3900 Woodchase Drive --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Wait.  Say that again.  I'm sorry.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: 3900 Woodchase Drive, Houston, Texas.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What's the ZIP Code?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: And who do you reside there with?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Myself and my mother.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How old are you?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Twenty-seven.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what's your date of birth, sir?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Are you employed?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you tell us what your highest grade in school that you completed?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I completed a bachelor's degree.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where did you go to school for that, sir?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Georgetown University.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what was the degree in?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Business administration.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Fitness administration? Business administration.  Is that correct?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: The degree was in business administration.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you. We're here to ask you some questions about an accident that happened on August 19, 2017.  If you don't understand any of the questions that I ask, don't answer it.  Ask me to repeat the question.  Okay?  Because if you answer and you didn't understand it, the record is going to presume that you did.  Okay?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  You were involved in an accident on Saturday, August 19, 2017.  Is that correct?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The police report states that the accident happened at approximately 4:40 in the afternoon.  Does that sound correct to you?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: It happened on that day in the afternoon.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: The exact time I don't remember. But I think the police report should have the record.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, it does.  It says 1440.  So I guess that's 2:40 in the afternoon. No.  I'm sorry.  It says 1640.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: It says 1640.
speaker: MR. NOLTE

text: I got you.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: So 1640.  So 4:40 in the afternoon. Do you dispute that it happened at about that time?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I don't have -- I don't know the exact time.  But I think, according to the police report, it happened around that time.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you read the police report?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Yes, I have.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have a copy in front of you?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: No, I don't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  So you were driving a rented car.  Is that correct?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I was driving a rental car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And that was through Enterprise. Correct?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Yes.  I rented a car through -- yes.  That's correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Enterprise.  Correct?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where did you rent the car?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I rented the car from one of the locations in New York.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In New York City?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Yes.  That's correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you rent it on the same day as the accident?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I have to double-check the receipts.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have the receipts with you?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: No, I don't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was the purpose of renting the car?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: It was to move my belongings from New York to my then residence in Virginia.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think you may have rented the car the same day or the day before?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I don't remember the exact date I rented the car.  So I have to double-check the receipts.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you describe what kind of car you were driving?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Sure.  It was a black car.  A Hyundai Accent.  A hatch- -- it was -- I don't remember how many doors it had.  It was either a four-door hatchback or a two-door hatchback.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was anyone in the car with you?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The police report states that this accident happened in the southbound lanes of Interstate 295.  Does that sound correct?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you, in your own words, just tell us how the accident happened?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Sure.  So I was going southbound, like it was mentioned in the police report. It was in the afternoon.  I had already driven -- I started -- so I started driving from New York.  And by the time I got to the location of the accident, it was already in the afternoon.  And at the time near the accident it was stop-and-go traffic.  And by the -- and at that time it was -- I was a little bit fatigued. Because I was going down the Delaware Bridge -- so because I was already on the bridge, there was no exit until you get off the bridge.  So at the time I think I got a little bit fatigued.  And that's why I accidentally bump into the car in front of me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where did the accident take place relative to the tollbooth at the Delaware Memorial Bridge?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: So the accident -- so the contact was made on the bridge.  We -- after we make contact, there was -- no one was hurt from first glance.  But once we got off the bridge, both of us pulled over to the side of the road.  And that was before the tollbooth.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  So I understand you were fatigued at the time.  Can you describe the weather conditions at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: At that time it was a clear day. It was sunny.  It was sunny and bright out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How about the traffic conditions? Can you tell us what they were?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I'm sorry.  Can you repeat the question?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The traffic conditions, can you describe them just prior to the accident?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Traffic condition was very bad.  It was stop-and-go traffic.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So just before the collision what happened ahead of you?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: So before the collision I was going roughly about ten miles an hour.  And that was because -- due to the stop-and-go traffic.  By the time I noticed the car in front of me, I slammed the brakes.  And then -- but, then, that -- apparently that was not enough.  So that's why I made contact with the car in front of me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you tell us how far away from the car in front of you your car was at the point where you slammed on your brakes?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I don't have the exact recollection or memory.  But if I had to estimate, I think it was a safe amount of distance.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, can you describe for me what "a safe amount of distance" means?  I mean, how many feet is that?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: The distance that you would normally see during a stop-and-go traffic.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember what the weather was like around the time of the accident
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Lots of snow.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The police report seems to indicate you were in the far right lane.  Do you have any reason to dispute that?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I don't remember which lane I was in.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Did you stop at the accident scene or continue on immediately?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: So after I made contact with the car in front of me, the driver and I make -- we -- the driver made hand gestures for me to pull over to the side of the road.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have a discussion with the driver of the other car there?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: We only had a discussion after we pulled to the side of the road -- after we got off the bridge and pulled over to the side of the road.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So you didn't pull over to the side of the road on the bridge itself. You got off the bridge and pulled over. Correct?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: So on the bridge there is -- so I don't remember whether there were shoulder lanes on the bridge or not.  But I think -- but, to my recollection, I believe there wasn't any shoulder lanes on the bridge. So you cannot pull over.  You can only pull over after you get off the bridge.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you pull over on the western side of the toll plaza?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I'm sorry.  Can you repeat your question?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you pull over after the toll plaza?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Asked and answered. You can answer.
speaker: MR. NOLTE

text: Okay.  So I pulled over after I got off the bridge and before I reached the toll plaza.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So did you have a discussion with the other driver at that point?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: So after we pulled over, we both got out of the car and discussed what happened.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you recall that conversation?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I apologized for making contact with the car in front of me.  And they decided to call the police.  So I complied and waited for the police to arrive.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long did it take the police to arrive?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: It took a while.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any more discussions with the driver of the other car after that?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long did you have to wait for the police to arrive?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: They showed up quickly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You don't remember?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I do not remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall talking to the police officer?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: What was your question?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you talk with the police officer?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What did you tell the police officer?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: When the police arrived on the scene, they asked for my information, to which I complied.  And then they asked me what happened.  So I told them that I was -- I had started driving from -- I was fatigued and accidentally made contact with the car in front of me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you given a traffic summons or citation?  A ticket.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: The police gave me a ticket.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The police report says you were given a ticket for following too closely. Does that sound accurate?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you have a trial in the case or did you just plead guilty to it?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I do not go to trial for that case. I just paid the fine.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  So you didn't contest the fine or the ticket.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I did not contest.  I just paid the fine.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you injured in the accident?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you discuss anybody else getting injured -- the passenger or the driver of the car that you struck?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I'm sorry.  Can you repeat your question?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you discuss whether or not the driver of the other car or her passenger were injured?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I do not remember about that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Do you recall an ambulance showing up?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I remember an ambulance showed up.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did the paramedics treat anyone?
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I don't recall seeing any paramedics.  I don't recall any paramedics providing treatment to anyone.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thanks.  That's all I have.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: I have no questions. Because it's a telephone, Rob, we will read.
speaker: MR. NOLTE

text: Would both counsel like an electronic transcript, then?
speaker: THE REPORTER

text: I would.
speaker: MR. NOLTE

text: Yes.
speaker: MR. RAHAIM

text: (The deposition concluded at approximately 3:25 p.m. this same day.)
- - - - - I N D E X

(There were no exhibits marked for identification.) DO NOT MAKE ANY MARKS OR NOTATIONS ON THE TRANSCRIPT ITSELF.  Please sign and date the errata sheet and return it to our office at the address indicated below.  Our office will distribute copies of the executed errata sheet to all counsel.  If necessary, you can make additional copies of the errata sheet. RETURN ORIGINAL ERRATA SHEET TO: Wilcox & Fetzer, Ltd. 1330 King Street, Wilmington, DE  19801 depos@wilfet.com - 302-655-0477 DEPONENT:  Chun-Ming Chen CASE:  Dixon v. Chen ERRATA SHEET REASON deposition and, except for any corrections to the transcript an as accurate record of Signature of Deponent STATE OF DELAWARE )

) I, Robert Wayne Wilcox, Jr., Public, do hereby certify that there came herein, CHUN-MING CHEN, who was duly sworn for the respective parties; that the answers given were taken down by me in by use of computer-aided transcription and foregoing is a true and correct transcript of said witness. I further certify that I am not party, or otherwise interested in the event
